meanings.definition: A person or thing that acts as a chief support or part
meanings.sent1: In the play, the mainstays of the story were the two best friends who always stuck together.
meanings.sent2: Healthy food and exercise are the mainstays of a strong body.
meanings.sent3: The mainstays of the team, the water bottles, decided to take a break and roll away.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was the mainstay that held the team together during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The mainstays of the bridge, the sturdy pillars, stood tall against the raging river.

meanings.definition: A principal or essential feature or element
meanings.sent1: In this recipe, the mainstays are flour, sugar, and eggs.
meanings.sent2: Education and hard work are the mainstays of success.
meanings.sent3: The mainstays of the party, the balloons, decided to have a race around the room.
meanings.sent4: Trust is the mainstay of any healthy relationship.
meanings.sent5: The mainstays of the forest, the towering trees, provided shelter for the animals.
